intro: Aphelandra villonacensis, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its striking, pendulous inflorescences. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green color. Its flowers are yellow with red veins, adding to its ornamental value. Aphelandra villonacensis is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid environments.
